00024 /**
00025  * Autoload classes.
00026  */
00027 function __autoload($class_name)
00028 {
00029         if (stristr($class_name, 'amazon'))
00030         {
00031                 require_once(dirname(__FILE__) . '/' . str_replace('amazon', '', strtolower($class_name)) . '.class.php');
00032         }
00033         elseif (stristr($class_name, 'tarzan'))
00034         {
00035                 require_once(dirname(__FILE__) . '/' . str_replace('tarzan', '_', strtolower($class_name)) . '.class.php');
00036         }
00037 }

00057 define('TARZAN_BUILD', gmdate('YmdHis', strtotime(substr('$Date$', 7, 25)) ? strtotime(substr('$Date$', 7, 25)) : filemtime(__FILE__)));

00092 /**
00093  * Wrapper for common AWS functions
00094  */
00095 class TarzanCore
00096 {
00097         /**
00098          * @var The Amazon API Key
00099          */
00100         var $key;
00101 
00102         /**
00103          * @var The Amazon API Secret Key
00104          */
00105         var $secret_key;
00106 
00107         /**
00108          * @var The Amazon Account ID, sans hyphens
00109          */
00110         var $account_id;
00111 
00112         /**
00113          * @var The Amazon Associates ID
00114          */
00115         var $assoc_id;
00116 
00117         /**
00118          * @var Handle for the utility functions
00119          */
00120         var $util;
00121 
00122         /**
00123          * @var An identifier for the current service.
00124          */
00125         var $service = null;
00126 
00127         /**
00128          * @var API version.
00129          */
00130         var $api_version = null;
00131 
00132         /**
00133          * @var The default class to use for Utilities.
00134          */
00135         var $utilities_class = 'TarzanUtilities';
00136 
00137         /**
00138          * @var The default class to use for HTTP Requests.
00139          */
00140         var $request_class = 'TarzanHTTPRequest';
00141 
00142         /**
00143          * @var The default class to use for HTTP Responses.
00144          */
00145         var $response_class = 'TarzanHTTPResponse';
00146 
00147         /**
00148          * @var The number of seconds to adjust the request timestamp by.
00149          */
00150         var $adjust_offset = 0;
00151 
00152 
00153         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00154         // CONSTRUCTOR
00155 
00156         /**
00157          * Constructor
00158          *
00159          * Constructs a new instance of the TarzanCore class.
00160          *
00161          * @access public
00162          * @param string $key Your Amazon API Key. If blank, it will look for the AWS_KEY constant.
00163          * @param string $secret_key Your Amazon API Secret Key. If blank, it will look for the AWS_SECRET_KEY constant.
00164          * @param string $account_id Your Amazon account ID without the hyphens. Required for EC2. If blank, it will look for the AWS_ACCOUNT_ID constant.
00165          * @param string $assoc_id Your Amazon Associates ID. Required for AAWS. If blank, it will look for the AWS_ASSOC_ID constant.
00166          * @return bool FALSE if no valid values are set, otherwise true.
00167          */
00168         public function __construct($key = null, $secret_key = null, $account_id = null, $assoc_id = null)
00169         {
00170                 // Instantiate the utilities class.
00171                 $this->util = new $this->utilities_class();
00172 
00173                 // Determine the current service.
00174                 $this->service = get_class($this);
00175 
00176                 // Set a default value for the Account ID.
00177                 if (!$account_id && defined('AWS_ACCOUNT_ID'))
00178                 {
00179                         $this->account_id = AWS_ACCOUNT_ID;
00180                 }
00181                 else // Move this to the EC2 class.
00182                 {
00183                         error_log('Tarzan: No Amazon account ID was passed into the constructor, nor was it set in the AWS_ACCOUNT_ID constant. Only required for EC2.');
00184                 }
00185 
00186                 // Set a default value for the Associates ID.
00187                 if (!$assoc_id && defined('AWS_ASSOC_ID'))
00188                 {
00189                         $this->assoc_id = AWS_ASSOC_ID;
00190                 }
00191                 else // Move this to the AAWS class.
00192                 {
00193                         error_log('Tarzan: No Amazon Associates ID was passed into the constructor, nor was it set in the AWS_ASSOC_ID constant. Only required for AAWS.');
00194                 }
00195 
00196                 // If both a key and secret key are passed in, use those.
00197                 if ($key && $secret_key)
00198                 {
00199                         $this->key = $key;
00200                         $this->secret_key = $secret_key;
00201                         return true;
00202                 }
00203 
00204                 // If neither are passed in, look for the constants instead.
00205                 else if (defined('AWS_KEY') && defined('AWS_SECRET_KEY'))
00206                 {
00207                         $this->key = AWS_KEY;
00208                         $this->secret_key = AWS_SECRET_KEY;
00209                         return true;
00210                 }
00211 
00212                 // Otherwise set the values to blank and return false.
00213                 else
00214                 {
00215                         $this->key = '';
00216                         $this->secret_key = '';
00217                         return false;
00218                 }
00219         }
00220 
00221 
00222         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00223         // SET CUSTOM SETTINGS
00224 
00225         /**
00226          * Adjust Offset
00227          * 
00228          * Allows you to adjust the current time, for occasions when your server is out of sync with 
00229          * Amazon's servers.
00230          * 
00231          * @param string $seconds (Required) The number of seconds to adjust the sent timestamp by.
00232          * @return void
00233          */
00234         public function adjust_offset($seconds)
00235         {
00236                 $this->adjust_offset = $seconds;
00237         }
00238 
00239 
00240         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00241         // SET CUSTOM CLASSES
00242 
00243         /**
00244          * Set Utilities Class
00245          * 
00246          * Set a custom class for this functionality. Perfect for extending/overriding existing classes with new functionality.
00247          * 
00248          * @param string $class (Optional) The name of the new class to use for this functionality. Defaults to the default class.
00249          * @return void
00250          */
00251         function set_utilities_class($class = 'TarzanUtilities')
00252         {
00253                 $this->utilities_class = $class;
00254                 $this->util = new $this->utilities_class();
00255         }
00256 
00257         /**
00258          * Set Request Class
00259          * 
00260          * Set a custom class for this functionality. Perfect for extending/overriding existing classes with new functionality.
00261          * 
00262          * @param string $class (Optional) The name of the new class to use for this functionality. Defaults to the default class.
00263          * @return void
00264          */
00265         function set_request_class($class = 'TarzanHTTPRequest')
00266         {
00267                 $this->request_class = $class;
00268         }
00269 
00270         /**
00271          * Set Response Class
00272          * 
00273          * Set a custom class for this functionality. Perfect for extending/overriding existing classes with new functionality.
00274          * 
00275          * @param string $class (Optional) The name of the new class to use for this functionality. Defaults to the default class.
00276          * @return void
00277          */
00278         function set_response_class($class = 'TarzanHTTPResponse')
00279         {
00280                 $this->response_class = $class;
00281         }
00282 
00283 
00284         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00285         // AUTHENTICATION
00286 
00287         /**
00288          * Authenticate
00289          *
00290          * Authenticates a connection to AWS and is used by EC2, SQS, and SimpleDB. This method is not 
00291          * intended to be manually called. Instead it is called by the other functions on a per-use basis.
00292          *
00293          * @access private
00294          * @param string $action (Required) Indicates the action to perform.
00295          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters for authenticating. See the individual methods for allowed keys.
00296          * @param string $queue_url (Optional) The URL of the queue to perform the action on.
00297          * @param string $message (Optional) This parameter is only used by the send_message() method.
00298          * @return object A TarzanHTTPResponse response object.
00299          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSSimpleQueueService/2008-01-01/SQSDeveloperGuide/Query_QueryAuth.html
00300          */
00301         public function authenticate($action, $opt = null, $queue_url = null, $message = null)
00302         {
00303                 // Manage the key-value pairs that are used in the query.
00304                 $query['Action'] = $action;
00305                 $query['AWSAccessKeyId'] = $this->key;
00306                 $query['SignatureVersion'] = 1;
00307                 $query['Timestamp'] = gmdate(DATE_AWS_ISO8601, time() + $this->adjust_offset);
00308                 $query['Version'] = $this->api_version;
00309 
00310                 // Merge in any options that were passed in
00311                 if (is_array($opt))
00312                 {
00313                         $query = array_merge($query, $opt);
00314                 }
00315 
00316                 // Do a case-insensitive, natural order sort on the array keys.
00317                 uksort($query, 'strnatcasecmp');
00318 
00319                 // Create the string that needs to be hashed.
00320                 $sign_query = $this->util->to_signable_string($query);
00321 
00322                 // Hash the AWS secret key and generate a signature for the request.
00323                 $query['Signature'] = $this->util->hex_to_base64(hash_hmac('sha1', $sign_query, $this->secret_key));
00324 
00325                 // Generate the querystring from $query
00326                 $querystring = $this->util->to_query_string($query);
00327 
00328                 // Compose the request.
00329                 $request_url = $queue_url . '?' . $querystring;
00330                 $request =& new $this->request_class($request_url);
00331 
00332                 // Tweak some things if we have a message (i.e. AmazonSQS::send_message()).
00333                 if ($message)
00334                 {
00335                         $request->addHeader('Content-Type', 'text/plain');
00336                         $request->setMethod(HTTP_POST);
00337                         $request->setBody($message);
00338                 }
00339 
00340                 // If we have a "true" value for returnCurlHandle, do that instead of completing the request.
00341                 if (isset($opt['returnCurlHandle']))
00342                 {
00343                         return $request->prepRequest();
00344                 }
00345 
00346                 // Send!
00347                 $request->sendRequest();
00348 
00349                 // Prepare the response.
00350                 $headers = $request->getResponseHeader();
00351                 $headers['x-tarzan-requesturl'] = $request_url;
00352                 $headers['x-tarzan-stringtosign'] = $sign_query;
00353                 if ($message) $headers['x-tarzan-body'] = $message;
00354                 $data = new $this->response_class($headers, $request->getResponseBody(), $request->getResponseCode());
00355 
00356                 // Return!
00357                 return $data;
00358         }
00359 }
